page.title: 14COLYTON CARNIVAL
page.content: Every year in September, Colyton holds a carnival. There is a carnival parade on the Saturday evening, in which floats from several other East Devon towns take part. The Carnival Queen is crowned in a special ceremony and then all the floats and other competitors walk around the streets of Colyton while some people collect money which is used for charities or local improvements such as a cover for the primary school's swimming pool. There are prizes for the best floats and costumes. Besides the procession, there is also a "Petticoat Lane" street market selling all kinds of articles. In the week before the Carnival procession there are other events such as competitions, displays, a street party etc., all aimed at raising money. Often several thousand pounds are raised from the carnival.
